result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Wolfe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus statutorily authorized surcharges.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: 20 days of sentence are stayed as long as Defendant is paying $75 per month toward financial obligations starting 11/1/15. Huber privileges granted. Report by March 1, 2016. Can be served in any county. Defendant is responsible for notifying Door County Jail if sentence is being served in different county.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Wolfe

defendant.name: Wolfe, David J
defendant.address: 215 S Taylor St  Apt 1, Green Bay, WI 54303

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for 1 year to pay restitution and Court-ordered financial obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant David J Wolfe in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (joint except jail). Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Bond continues as is.

Defendant David J Wolfe in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on failure to appear. Defendant got date mixed up, has been on pain medication. Court advises Defendant of issuance of warrant. Defense advises that Defendant called within 1/2 hour of missing court, believes Defendant is taking matter seriously. Court questions what payments have been made. Defendant has not made any payments, is in between housing situations with his fiance, has to pay 1/2 the rent to get place back, gets paid every week. Court questions how much has to be paid. Restitution is $120, also has to pay court costs. Defense advises that Defendant is willing to pay to show good faith effort, requests 30 days to see what Defendant can get paid. Court questions Defendant on income, questions whether he'll be able to get it paid in a month. Defendant believe he can get it paid in a month. Court will not grant any further time beyond next hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that he expected case to be resolved today, doesn't have any information about where Defendant is. State advises no payments have been made, requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant David J Wolfe in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is starting job today, will have to talk with DA Pelrine regarding payments, requests continuance.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David J Wolfe appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Ray Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is calling from his home in Green Bay. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that he has received discovery and offer, needs to discuss it with Defendant, requests status/possible plea.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
Not to write any checks. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant David J Wolfe in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
